item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (309 points | 415 comments)
2. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (21 points | 2 comments)
3. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (43 points | 23 comments)
4. Kalman Filter Tutorial (238 points | 51 comments)
5. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (109 points | 24 comments)
6. VS Code Pets (330 points | 81 comments)

8. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (42 points | 2 comments)
9. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (43 points | 7 comments)
10. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (116 points | 66 comments)
11. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (19 points | 2 comments)
12. Boosting Computational Fluid Dynamics Performance with AMD MI300X (13 points | 1 comment)
13. Beating cuBLAS in Single-Precision General Matrix Multiplication (65 points | 1 comment)
14. How I built this website on a Raspberry Pi (16 points | 4 comments)
15. Why do bees die when they sting you? (252 points | 193 comments)
16. Pharaoh's Tomb HD – A Remake Made in JavaScript with Kaplay (82 points | 33 comments)

18. Second-Hand Bookshops in Britain: 2024 Report (49 points | 4 comments)
19. WASM GC isn't ready for realtime graphics (92 points | 36 comments)
20. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (194 points | 57 comments)
21. The AMD Radeon Instinct MI300A's Giant Memory Subsystem (187 points | 80 comments)
22. Dusa Programming Language (Finite-Choice Logic Programming) (136 points | 27 comments)
23. Skymont: Intel's E-Cores reach for the Sky (100 points | 57 comments)
24. Show HN: LLMpeg (103 points | 48 comments)
25. Reverse-engineering a carry-lookahead adder in the Pentium (60 points | 10 comments)
26. Nation-scale Matrix deployments will fail using the community version of Synapse (91 points | 73 comments)
27. Saint Peter Basilica digital experience (98 points | 20 comments)
28. Borrowchecker.jl – Designing a borrow checker for Julia (47 points | 4 comments)
29. Amazon's AI crawler is making my Git server unstable (529 points | 204 comments)
30. Can you read this cursive handwriting? The National Archives wants your help (236 points | 238 comments)
